Operation 'Createnewsession' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity on what constitutes the response payload and doesn't explicitly state the 201 status code. Added specificity about namespace handling, return values, and practical guidance for non-browser environments to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
Creates a new session and returns a session token and a segment token. Also stores `vtex_session` and `vtex_segment` cookies, with the same values returned in the response.

All parameters in the body that are not within the public namespace will be ignored. Query string items will automatically be added to the public namespace.

>⚠️ The Session Manager API uses the `vtex_session` and `vtex_segment` cookies to store the data required to identify the user and the session. These cookies are stored in the user's browser when the session is created and sent automatically in every request to that domain. You will have to reproduce that by sending these cookies as headers in other requests to Session Manager API in order for it to work outside of a browser environment.

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [authentication](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication) or [permissions](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new customer browsing session and returns session and segment tokens. The operation stores `vtex_session` and `vtex_segment` cookies containing session identifiers. Request body parameters outside the `public` namespace are ignored; query string parameters are automatically added to the `public` namespace. Returns a 201 response with session token, segment token, and session metadata. No authentication required. Note: When using this API outside a browser environment, manually include the returned `vtex_session` and `vtex_segment` cookies as headers in subsequent requests.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity on what constitutes the response payload and doesn't explicitly state the 201 status code. Added specificity about namespace handling, return values, and practical guidance for non-browser environments to improve AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'GetSession' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is too generic and doesn't indicate what type of information is retrieved. Description lacks input requirements (cookie/token headers) and output details. Added specificity about required headers, response content, and practical guidance for AI agents to understand when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
Retrieves information from a previously created sesssion.

 >⚠️ The Session Manager API uses the `vtex_session` and `vtex_segment` cookies to store the data required to identify the user and the session. These cookies are stored in the user's browser when the session is created and sent automatically in every request to that domain. You will have to reproduce that by sending these cookies as headers to Session Manager API in order for it to work outside of a browser environment.

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [authentication](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication) or [permissions](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information about a previously created customer session, including cookies, query strings, authentication credentials, profile data, and pricing information. Requires the `vtex_session` and `vtex_segment` cookies (or tokens) to be sent as headers to identify the session. Returns a 200 response with complete session metadata. No authentication required. The operation uses session cookies to identify which session to retrieve; in non-browser environments, manually include these cookies as request headers.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic and doesn't indicate what type of information is retrieved. Description lacks input requirements (cookie/token headers) and output details. Added specificity about required headers, response content, and practical guidance for AI agents to understand when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'Editsession' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is too generic. Description is verbose and references another endpoint instead of being self-contained. Missing clarity on required headers, what gets updated, and return value. Improved version clarifies input requirements, namespace handling, response status, and partial update behavior for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
Edits information from a previously created sesssion.

 This endpoint works the same way as the [Create new session](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/session-manager-api#post-/api/sessions) endpoint, but when the request is sent with a `vtex_session` and the `vtex_segment` cookies in the header, it retrieves the session first and then applies the changes instead of generating a new one.

Only keys inside the `public` namespace in the request body are considered, and query parameters are automatically added to the public namespace.

>⚠️ The Session Manager API uses the `vtex_session` and `vtex_segment` cookies to store the data required to identify the user and the session. These cookies are stored in the user's browser when the session is created and sent automatically in every request to that domain. You will have to reproduce that by sending these cookies as headers to Session Manager API in order for it to work outside of a browser environment.
 
## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [authentication](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication) or [permissions](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing customer session by applying changes to session data. Requires `vtex_session` and `vtex_segment` cookies (or tokens) in request headers to identify the target session. Only properties within the `public` namespace in the request body are applied; query parameters are automatically added to the `public` namespace. Returns a 200 response with the updated session information. If cookies are not provided, behaves like Create new session. No authentication required. Partial updates are supported—only provided fields are modified.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description is verbose and references another endpoint instead of being self-contained. Missing clarity on required headers, what gets updated, and return value. Improved version clarifies input requirements, namespace handling, response status, and partial update behavior for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'GetSegment' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is too generic and doesn't clarify what 'segment' means in this domain. Description lacks clarity on input parameters and response content. Added domain context about segment as a shared customer profile, clarified which query parameters are supported, explained the distinction between temporary query overrides and persistent session updates, and specified the 200 response code for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
Retrieves information about the segment, which contains additional data related to the session's context.

You can add certain public fields as the query string and the system will attempt to fulfill it. Values such as `cultureInfo` and `utm` are overwriteable, just keep in mind such changes will not be reflected in the client's session.

If you wish to change the value on the session (and thus be reflected on the segment without special query strings), then use the [Edit session](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/session-manager-api#patch-/api/sessions) endpoint.

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [authentication](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication) or [permissions](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves segment information containing contextual data about the customer's browsing profile, including culture info, UTM parameters, and other shared navigation attributes. Accepts optional query string parameters (e.g., `cultureInfo`, `utm`) to customize the segment response; these parameters override defaults but do not persist to the session. Returns a 200 response with segment metadata. To permanently update session values reflected in the segment, use the Edit session endpoint instead. No authentication required.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic and doesn't clarify what 'segment' means in this domain. Description lacks clarity on input parameters and response content. Added domain context about segment as a shared customer profile, clarified which query parameters are supported, explained the distinction between temporary query overrides and persistent session updates, and specified the 200 response code for better AI agent interpretability.
